cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 350 mi NE of the north-western Bahamas and 460 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the north-western Bahamas, expected to turn WNW across the Florida Peninsula, then curve NW–N toward southern Georgia and the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (Boca Raton – Flagler/Volusia Co. line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL and Flagler/Volusia Co. line FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Altamaha Sound GA to Savannah River GA and south of Hallandale Beach FL to north of Ocean Reef FL; north of Bonita Beach FL to the Ochlockonee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Boca Raton FL to Flagler/Volusia Co. line FL and portions of the north-western Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning: Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL, Flagler/Volusia Co. line FL to Altamaha Sound GA, Lake Okeechobee, Andros, New Providence, Eleuthera
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, north-western Bahamas, and eventually portions of Georgia and the Carolinas; Gulf impacts confined mainly to Florida Big Bend and west-central FL coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy at times late Thursday into early Friday; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤4% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Mobile Bay; surge focus is farther east along the Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring light to moderate showers Thursday–Friday, generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher swells in the north-central Gulf may affect vessel operations, but significant coastal hazards at Mobile, AL are not anticipated.
